<<<<<<< HEAD
Roma ruit the pillars of Rome broken : wherein all the several pleas for the Pope's authority in England, with all the material defences of them, as they have been urged by Romanists from the beginning of our reformation to this day are revised and answered ; to which is subjoyned A seasonable alarm to all sorts of Englishmen against popery, both from their oaths and their interests / by Fr. Fullwood ... Fullwood, Francis, d. 1693.
[30], 288, [8] p., [4] leaves of plates : 4 ports.
Printed for Richard Royston ..., London : 1679.
Errata: p. [30] Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
=======
Roma ruit the pillars of Rome broken : wherein all the several pleas for the Pope's authority in England, with all the material defences of them, as they have been urged by Romanists from the beginning of our reformation to this day are revised and answered ; to which is subjoyned A seasonable alarm to all sorts of Englishmen against popery, both from their oaths and their interests / by Fr. Fullwood ... Fullwood, Francis, d. 1693.
[30], 288, [8] p., [4] leaves of plates : 4 ports.
Printed for Richard Royston ..., London : 1679.
Errata: p. [30] Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
